p: In addition to cancerous involvement, anatomical variations ( Figure 3) or previous damages on the vessel, the main causes of injuries on the RGEA and RGEV are severe tissue adhesion ( 2, 3). Once the vessels were severed during the operation, surgeons used to perform gastrectomy and esophageal reconstruction with a long colon or jejunum segment, which may cause greater risk of complications ( 2). Therefore, it is of great clinical significance to ensure effective vascular reconstruction.
